Articles.Content:
(Sorry, I don't have an account on any filehost to put a download link)

The Colossus-Class Space Colony (CCSC) is a colossal space station.

It's hard to get in orbit with hyperedit (you need to be quick or stuff will detach from hubs), and even harder with a rocket. So I suggest replicas are built with docks to make it piece by piece.

FEATURES:

Deployable Rockets (With thrusters, Laser Weapons)

Solar Panels

Lights

DEADLY Lasers

and More

MOD PARTS:

KW Rocketry Fuel Tanks, For Structural use and for the fuel on deployable rockets.

KW Rocketry Engine, For the deployable rockets.

Sunbeam Laser Weapon

STOCK PARTS

C7 Aerospace MK1 and MK2 Cockpits, one of each on the deployable rockets.

Unmanned disc (Forgot what part it is, but its the larger version. No it's not an OKTO, its the flat circle disc one.)

For control of the station

Multi-Hub Connectors (2) for girder and structure connection. Also to hold the decoupling rings connecting the rockets to the ship.

Docking Ports (2) one is a clamp-o-tron XL, located on top of the control. Other is a clamp-o-tron sheilded docking port, on the hub that holds the deployable rockets.

Gigatotron-WhateverIforgotthename Solar Panels, for electricity to the lights.

Lights

Generators, for when the solar panels are not being used (Re-Entry/Takeoff/Not in sunlight)

Girders (At the middle, to hold struts that help keep the station together.

EXTRA FACTS

-This is an upgraded version of the Space Station I made.

-The Deployable rockets also can be used as a crew holder, each rocket holds Two Kerbonauts. That's Eight Kerbonauts, because their are Four rockets.

PICTURES

(Note: These are the ones from Sunbase Beta. There is also another one, The International Space Station.)

The Colony.

Another View.

I think it looks really cool.

How's your frame rate?

Anyone like it? I worked hard.

I wouldn't expect a sea of comments, this isn't really anything out of the ordinary.

That being said, it looks nice good job
My frame rate is kinda laggy. I blame steam, or the game. Probably the game. It seems to be very resource demanding.
